Extract

 

  Ceres, which orbits the Sun in the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter, is a unique body in the Solar System, bearing many similarities to Jupiter’s moon Europa and Saturn’s moon Enceladus, both considered to be potential sources for harboring life. This March, 2015, the Dawn mission will arrive at Ceres, the first of the smaller class of planets to be discovered and the closest to Earth. The NASA animation above, enhanced with a star field and projected onto a sphere, showcases a series of images NASA’s Dawn spacecraft took on approach to Ceres on Feb. 4, 2015 at a distance of about 90,000 miles (145,000 kilometers) from the dwarf planet  This animation showcases a series of images NASA’s Dawn spacecraft took on approach to Ce…
